page.title: 01Uplands and Marsh Near Rye
page.content: The area, lying partly in the Sussex Parishes of Playden, Iden and East Guildford and the Kent Parish of Brookland is agricultural. It is divided into two parts by the River Rother which flows towards Rye. To the East & North of the River the reclaimed marshland is flat & low- lying, almost at sea level. It contains a network of sea defence embankments called "innings" and ditches called "sewers" outfalling to the River or Royal Military Canal which joins the River at Iden Lock. To the west of the River the land rises to the Uplands reaching 150 feet above sea level via a steep sandstone cliff. In the uplands there is mixed farming. The reclaimed marshland is used for arable crops & sheep. Traversing the marsh is a single track railway line connecting Rye to Ashford.
